lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Luke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Luke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Luke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
Luke is an interactive desktop application that serves as a task manager that operates in the Command Line Interface.
1. Ensure you have installed Java `11` or above on your computer.
2. Download the `ip.jar` file from v0.2 from this [link](https://github.com/williamlamjy/ip/releases)
3. Note down where you have downloaded the `ip.jar` file and **copy the filepath**.
4. Open your terminal and navigate to your `ip.jar` file by **pasting the filepath**.
5. Enter the command `java -jar iP.jar` to run Luke.
6. The corresponding `welcome message` will be displayed.
Adds a task of type `todo` to the task list. A todo task contains a **description**.
Noted! I have added this task:
Now you have 8 tasks in your list.
Adds a task of type `deadline` to the task list. A deadline task contains a **description** and **deadline date**.
The **deadline date** must have a `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Noted! I have added this task:
Now you have 9 tasks in your list.
Adds a task of type `event` to the task list. An event task contains a **description** and **duration**.
Noted! I have added this task:
Now you have 10 tasks in your list.
Shows a list of all the current tasks.
Okay! Here are your current tasks:
### Checking off a task as done: `done`
Checks off a task as completed.
- `TASK_NUMBER` is the task number shown on the list.
Nice! I have marked this task as done:
Shows a list of tasks that contains the `SEARCH_QUERY` keyed in.
- `SEARCH_QUERY` can be any word or phrase.
Deletes a task from the list.
- `TASK_NUMBER` is the task number shown on the list.
Noted! I have deleted this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in your list
Terminates the program and shows the goodbye message.
Bye! Hope to see you soon
Luke **automatically stores the data** of the task list
and will **load** up the task list stored in the last session for your current session.
* This program acts as a task manager list. It is able to read in tasks and add them to the list.
* It is able to mark tasks complete, find tasks, delete tasks and print current tasks out.
* This is the startup of the program. The file storage, user interface and TaskList is initialized here.
* Any error with the file loading will lead to termination of the program.
* @param filePath path of the file where data of the pre-existing task list is stored at.
* Runs the program and reads in input from the user and executes the corresponding command.
* Any error in the input will be reflected through error messages.
* Main method creates the instance of the program and runs it.
* This is the parent class to the extended task classes.
* Gets the X icon to be shown if the task is completed.
* Checks if the task is completed.
* Formats the task to be written into the file.
* This enables more convenient reading of the file.
* Returns a formatted task to the user on the command line interface.
* This class contains the arraylist for all the current tasks.
* It is then able to handle functions to the tasks like add,delete and checkOff.
* Gets a task and returns a string with a format to write into the luke file.
* This format enables easier reading and processing of the tasks in the file.
* @param taskIndex Index of the task to format
* Returns a new taskList of the tasks that contains the searchQuery.
* @param searchQuery Word or phrase input to search for
* @return TaskList of tasks containing the searchQuery
* This class adds a tasks to the task list.
* @param task Task that will be added.
* Executes adding the task to the task list.
* Shows the AddTask messages through the ui.
* Saves the data in the file.
* @throws IOException Thrown when there is an error writing to the file.
* This class checks off a task in the task list as done.
* @param taskNoCompletedIndex Index of the task that is completed.
* Executes checking off the task in the task list.
* Shows the message after checking off the task.
* Stores the data by writing into the file
* @throws IOException                 Thrown when there is an error writing into the file
* @throws IllegalNumberInputException Thrown when the index provided is not within the size of the task list.
public void execute() throws IOException, IllegalNumberInputException {
* This is the parent class to the extended command classes.

* This class stores the messages that are shown to the user on the command line interface.
public static final String GOODBYE_MESSAGE = "Bye! Hope to see you soon";
public static final String TASK_ADDED_MESSAGE = "Noted! I have added this task:";
public static final String TASK_COMPLETED_MESSAGE = "Nice! I have marked this task as done:";
public static final String TASK_DELETED_MESSAGE = "Noted! I have deleted this task:";
public static final String TASK_LIST_MESSAGE = "Okay! Here are your current tasks:";
public static final String FILE_ERROR_MESSAGE = "Oh no! There seems to be an error loading this file";
public static final String INVALID_SEARCH_MESSAGE = "Oh no! I cant find what you are looking for";
public static final String EMPTY_TASK_LIST_MESSAGE = "Stop worrying! You have no tasks for now";
public static final String FUNCTIONS_USER_GUIDE_MESSAGE = "done: marks a task from the list complete "
+ "delete: deletes a task from the list "
+ "find: finds all matching tasks to your search query"
public static final String TASKS_USER_GUIDE_MESSAGE = "todo: Adds a new todo task "

+ "Im your very own personal task manager!\n"
+ "\nOr you can amend your current tasks in your list!\n"
+ "list: lists all your current tasks in the list\n"

String errorMessage = "Please input a valid command number!\n" + FUNCTIONS_USER_GUIDE_MESSAGE;

+ "find: Finds a keyword and lists all relevant tasks"

+ "Please input a number that is within the range of the list";
